parts: {"items":[{"paper_title":"A Review on Agri-food Supply Chain Traceability by Means of RFID Technology","abstract":"Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) is a technology which provides appealing opportunities to improve the management of information flow within the supply chain and security in the agri-food sector. Nowadays, food safety is considered a major requirement in several countries, in particular, the traceability of food products which is mandatory by law. Thus, technological implementation leading to traceability strengthening in the agri-food sector is crucial. The first aim of this review is to analyze the current developments in RFID technology in the agri-food sector, through an operative framework which organizes the literature and facilitate a quick content analysis identifying future research direction. RFID technology seems to be able to bring great opportunities to this sector; nevertheless, several constraints are slowing its adoption. This survey may provide readers with an exhaustive overview of opportunities and constraints for the wide adoption of RFID. The second aim of this review is to provide an updated analysis on the current developments of RFID technology for different product typologies within the agri-food industry, discussing at the same time its potential in technological and logistical development regarding different sectors of the production/distribution chain. As referenced here, RFID implementations in the agri-food sector are increasing at a fast rate, and technological advancement follows the applicability opportunities. params.query: RFID technology in the food industry

parts:
RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) technology plays a crucial role in enhancing the efficiency, traceability, and safety of the food supply chain. Here are some key insights from recent research:

1. RFID technology offers significant opportunities to improve information management and security within the agri-food supply chain, facilitating traceability which is a legal requirement in many countries [(Costa et al., 2013)](https://consensus.app/papers/review-agrifood-supply-chain-traceability-means-rfid-costa/a05fc47a76d9594ab44ed0e25cf5a5af/?utm_source=chatgpt).
2. It has evolved beyond simple product identification, integrating with sensor technologies for monitoring environmental conditions such as temperature and humidity, crucial for ensuring food safety and quality [(Bibi et al., 2017)](https://consensus.app/papers/review-rfid-technology-sensing-aptitudes-food-industry-bibi/9d018d0c61df584daa83dd45360a7a79/?utm_source=chatgpt).
3. Chipless RFID sensors are being developed for food packaging applications, addressing the need for non-invasive, real-time monitoring of food quality across the supply chain [(Fathi et al., 2020)](https://consensus.app/papers/chipless-rfid-sensors-food-packaging-applications-review-fathi/eab4a13e99aa5ed58d2df5ab155e243a/?utm_source=chatgpt).
4. The technology enables significant benefits such as improved operational efficiency, reduced inventory losses, and enhanced quality control, yet its widespread adoption faces challenges like technical and economic obstacles [(Kumari et al., 2015)](https://consensus.app/papers/application-rfid-agrifood-sector-kumari/b73fac2c48e558ffb41c68b21d6f0228/?utm_source=chatgpt).
5. RFID combined with sensor network automation supports comprehensive supply chain visibility, from farm to fork, ensuring quality and safety of food products [(Piramuthu & Zhou, 2016)](https://consensus.app/papers/rfid-sensor-network-automation-food-industry-ensuring-piramuthu/eedbb8c6fe5f5ac89e21e7e682136f2a/?utm_source=chatgpt).

In summary, RFID technology, particularly when integrated with sensors, has the potential to revolutionize the food industry by enhancing traceability, ensuring product quality, and reducing wastage. However, widespread implementation is hindered by various challenges that need to be addressed.

For more AI-powered insights, go to [consensus.app](https://consensus.app/?utm_source=chatgpt).
